title.value: How Connectivity Structure Shapes Rich and Lazy Learning in Neural Circuits
title.justification: The title directly reflects the paper's investigation into how different initial weight structures affect the learning regimes in neural networks, with 'rich' and 'lazy' learning as the core focus.
title.quote: H OW CONNECTIVITY STRUCTURE SHAPES RICH AND LAZY LEARNING IN NEURAL CIRCUITS

extractions.description: This paper investigates the impact of initial weight structures, particularly their effective rank, on the learning dynamics of neural networks. It demonstrates that high-rank initializations lead to lazier learning, whereas low-rank initializations result in richer learning. These findings are grounded in theoretical derivations and empirical validations using recurrent neural networks (RNNs) on various tasks.

type.justification: The paper includes theoretical derivations in a two-layer feedforward linear network and extends these results empirically, focusing on the theory behind network initialization and its effects.
type.quote: Through theoretical derivation in two-layer feedforward linear network, we demonstrate that higher-rank initialization results in effectively lazier learning on average across tasks

name.justification: The study revolves around neural networks, a fundamental aspect of Deep Learning, and explores their learning dynamics based on initial weight structures.
name.quote: In deep learning, structure, encompassing architecture and initial connectivity, crucially dictates learning speed and effectiveness

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses how the learning dynamics of neural networks are influenced by their initial weight structures, which falls under the study of neural network learning dynamics.
name.quote: here we investigate how the structure of the initial weights \\u2014 in particular their effective rank \\u2014 influences the network learning regime

name.justification: RNNs are used to validate the theoretical findings through numerical experiments on neuroscience tasks.
name.quote: We validate our theoretical findings in recurrent neural networks (RNNs) through numerical experiments on well-known neuroscience tasks

name.justification: The paper uses Neurogym tasks like two-alternative forced choice, delayed-match-to-sample, and context-dependent decision-making to validate their theoretical findings in RNNs.
name.quote: For our investigations, we applied this initialization scheme across a variety of cognitive tasks \\u2014 including two-alternative forced choice (2AF), delayed-match-to-sample (DMS), context-dependent decision-making (CXT) tasks \\u2014 implemented with Neurogym

name.justification: sMNIST is employed to demonstrate the findings on a well-known machine learning benchmark task.
name.quote: and the well-known machine learning benchmark sequential MNIST (sMNIST). Figure 1 indicates that low-rank initial weights result in effectively richer learning and greater network changes.

name.justification: The paper utilizes PyTorch for implementing and training the RNN models used in their experiments.
